settings.text:
Everything you will ever touch is made of atoms. A knife’s edge, a mirror’sglass, a lover’s shoulder—all atoms. The source of the atoms is not amatter of scientific debate, though it sounds almost too magical to bebelieved: nearly everything that we are came from stars. Of course,

justbecause something is true does not mean it is not astonishing, improbable,or even inconceivable. A diamond is made up of just one kind of atom, manytimes over: carbon. Its complete chemical formula is exquisitely simple:C. Yet, as a matter of chemical fact, the same carbon atoms,

differentlyarranged, yield not a sparkling diamond, but gray pencil lead. The diamondis in the details. Yet, as a matter of chemical fact, the same.

Of course, just because something is true does not mean it is notastonishing, improbable, or even inconceivable. Everything you will ever touch is made of atoms. A knife’s edge, a mirror’sglass, a lover’s shoulder—all atoms. The source of the atoms is not amatter of scientific debate, though it sounds almost too magical to bebelieved: nearly everything that we are came from stars. Of course, justbecause something is true does not mean it is not astonishing, improbable,or even inconceivable. A diamond is made up of just one kind of atom, manytimes over: carbon. Its complete chemical formula is exquisitely simple: C. Yet, as a matter of chemical fact, the same carbon atoms, differentlyarranged, yield not a sparkling diamond, but gray pencil lead. The diamondis in the details. Yet, as a matter of chemical fact, the same.
